questiontext.text:
Exercise

In the following, eliminate the parameter to give the Cartesian equation in \(x\) and \(y\), writing your answer in a form that gives you information about the shape of the curve. You will also explore graphing the curves.

  1. \(x=t,\ \ y={@aa@}-t,\ \ \ \ 0\le t\le 1\)

    Cartesian Equation: [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

    Move the slider on the graph below to see how the graph changes, and then try to put the slider in the correct position to display the correct curve. Notice the range of \(t\).

    [Note: This part of the question is not marked and is just for exploration]

    2. [[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { // STACK: when moving to STACK change 'jxgboard' for divid boundingbox: [-1, 5, 4, -1], keepaspectratio: true, showCopyright: false, axis: true, showNavigation: true }); // Curve with sliders var a = board.create('slider', [[2,4],[4,4],[0,0,5]], {name: '', snapWidth: 0.5}); var f1 = board.create('functiongraph', [function(x){ return a.Value() - x;}, 0, 1]); [[/jsxgraph]]

  2. \(x={@bb@}-t,\ \ y=t+{@cc@},\ \ \ \ 0\le t\le\infty\)

    Cartesian Equation: [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

    Move the sliders on the graph below to see how the graph changes, and then try to put the sliders in the correct position to display the correct curve. Note the range of \(t\).

    [Note: This part of the question is not marked and is just for exploration]

    3. [[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { // STACK: when moving to STACK change 'jxgboard' for divid boundingbox: [-2, 6, 5, -2], keepaspectratio: true, showCopyright: false, axis: true, showNavigation: true }); // Curve with sliders var b = board.create('slider', [[2,5],[5,5],[0,0,7]], {name: '', snapWidth: 0.5}); var f2 = board.create('functiongraph', [function(x){ return b.Value() - x;}, -20, {#bb#}]); [[/jsxgraph]]

  3. \(x=\dfrac{{@dd@}}{t},\ \ y=t-{@ee@},\ \ \ \ 0<t<3\)

    Cartesian Equation: [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

    You should now sketch the curve on paper.

  4. \(x={@ff@}\sin \dfrac{\pi t}{2},\ \ y={@gg@}\cos\dfrac{\pi t}{2},\ \ \ \ {@tdmin@}\le t\le {@tdmax@}\)

    Cartesian Equation: [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]

    You should now sketch the curve on paper.

questionnote.text:
(a) \(x=t,\ y={@aa@}-t\), equation \(= {@ta1@}\), (b) \(x={@bb@}-t,\ y=t+{@cc@}\), equation \(= {@ta2@}\),

(c) \(x=\dfrac{{@dd@}}{t}, \ y=t-{@ee@}\), equation \(= {@ta3@}\), (d) \(x={@ff@}\sin \dfrac{\pi t}{2},\ \ y={@gg@}\cos\dfrac{\pi t}{2}\), equation \(= {@ta4@}\).
